channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israeli strike kills 5 Palestinian journalists in Gaza, officials say
item.description: An Israeli strike killed five Palestinian journalists outside a hospital in the Gaza Strip overnight, according to the Health Ministry. The Israeli military said it had targeted a group of militants.
item.content:encoded:
An Israeli strike killed five Palestinian journalists outside a hospital in the Gaza Strip overnight, according to the Health Ministry. The Israeli military said it had targeted a group of militants.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Minn. Democratic party chair says his wins could help nationally after loss to Trump
item.description: Ken Martin helped turn around the Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor Party's finances and secure a streak of statewide wins for the party over 18 years. Now, he wants to do the same thing for the Democratic National Committee.
item.content:encoded:
Ken Martin helped turn around the Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor Party's finances and secure a streak of statewide wins for the party over 18 years. Now, he wants to do the same thing for the Democratic National Committee.

(Image credit: Abbie Parr)
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: Popeye, Tintin and more will enter the public domain in the new year
item.description: The copyrights of thousands of 20th-century films, books, compositions and sound recordings expire on Jan. 1, making them free for anyone to share and adapt. Here are some of the highlights.
item.content:encoded:
The copyrights of thousands of 20th-century films, books, compositions and sound recordings expire on Jan. 1, making them free for anyone to share and adapt. Here are some of the highlights.

(Image credit: Jacques Brinon)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Remembering the actors, musicians, writers and artists we lost in 2024
item.description: Every year, we remember some of the writers, actors, musicians, filmmakers and performers who died over the past year, and whose lifetime of creative work helped shape our world.
item.content:encoded: Every year, we remember some of the writers, actors, musicians, filmmakers and performers who died over the past year, and whose lifetime of creative work helped shape our world.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Giving up alcohol for Dry January? Our newsletter can help you reach your goal
item.description: If your New Year's resolution is to drink less alcohol, Life Kit is here to help. Sign up for our Dry January newsletter series, and get tips and strategies to help you stay alcohol-free for a month.
item.content:encoded:
If your New Year's resolution is to drink less alcohol, Life Kit is here to help. Sign up for our Dry January newsletter series, and get tips and strategies to help you stay alcohol-free for a month.

(Image credit: Photo illustration by Beck Harlan)
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: 100-plus cities in the U.S. banned homeless camping this year. But will it work?
item.description: The burst of new laws follows a landmark Supreme Court ruling, and reflects public frustration with record-high homelessness. But advocates say fines and jail time will only make the problem worse.
item.content:encoded:
The burst of new laws follows a landmark Supreme Court ruling, and reflects public frustration with record-high homelessness. But advocates say fines and jail time will only make the problem worse.

(Image credit: Jamie Kelter Davis)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Snowboarder's death in Swiss Alps avalanche is a reminder that even pros face risk
item.description: The death of an Olympic snowboarding athlete is a reminder that even the most skilled and experienced athletes are not immune to the threat of avalanches, and that knowledge is key to staying safe.
item.content:encoded:
The death of an Olympic snowboarding athlete is a reminder that even the most skilled and experienced athletes are not immune to the threat of avalanches, and that knowledge is key to staying safe.

(Image credit: Millo Moravski/Agence Zoom/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Scientists await signal from spacecraft after historic close encounter with the sun
item.description: To get so close, the Parker Solar Probe had to withstand the sun's extreme heat and radiation like no spacecraft before it.
item.content:encoded:
To get so close, the Parker Solar Probe had to withstand the sun's extreme heat and radiation like no spacecraft before it.

(Image credit: Steve Gribben/AP)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Mega Millions jackpot surges past $1 billion
item.description: The Mega Millions prize has now grown to an estimated $1.15 billion, which could be the fifth-largest jackpot in the game's history.
item.content:encoded:
The Mega Millions prize has now grown to an estimated $1.15 billion, which could be the fifth-largest jackpot in the game's history.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Pope urges 'all people of all nations' to silence arms in Christmas address
item.description: Pope Francis in his traditional Christmas message urged "all people of all nations" to find courage "to silence the sounds of arms and overcome divisions" plaguing the world, from the Middle East to Ukraine, Africa to Asia.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis in his traditional Christmas message urged "all people of all nations" to find courage "to silence the sounds of arms and overcome divisions" plaguing the world, from the Middle East to Ukraine, Africa to Asia.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
